metadata.title: Texas & Federal Solar Incentives Database - February 2026

obbba.name: One Big Beautiful Bill Act
obbba.impact: Accelerated phase-out of IRA clean energy credits, ended residential ITC, new FEOC restrictions

critical_changes: Section 48E commercial ITC accelerated phase-out: begin construction by July 4, 2026 or place in service by Dec 31, 2027
Five Percent Safe Harbor ELIMINATED for solar/wind construction starting after September 2, 2025
Only Physical Work Test permitted for begin-construction determination
100% bonus depreciation reinstated permanently by OBBBA
FEOC restrictions now apply to all credits
No residential federal solar tax credit available for homeowner-owned systems in 2026

section_25d_residential_itc.name: Residential Clean Energy Credit (Section 25D)
section_25d_residential_itc.notes: Terminated by OBBBA. No residential ITC available for homeowner-owned systems installed after December 31, 2025. Unused credits from prior years may still roll over.
section_25d_residential_itc.alternative: Homeowners can still benefit through TPO (lease/PPA) arrangements where the commercial entity claims Section 48E

enhanced_rate_requirements.prevailing_wage: Laborers and mechanics paid no less than applicable prevailing wage rates
enhanced_rate_requirements.apprenticeship: Qualified apprentices employed from registered apprenticeship programs for required hours

small_project_exception.benefit: Projects under 1 MW AC qualify for 30% rate WITHOUT prevailing wage/apprenticeship requirements

critical_deadlines.safe_harbor_window: 4 years from construction start if begun before July 4, 2026

construction_test.small_solar_under_1_5mw: Pay or incur 5%+ of total eligible project costs
construction_test.large_solar_over_1_5mw: Physical work of substantial nature at project site required
construction_test.five_percent_safe_harbor: ELIMINATED for projects starting after September 2, 2025 (IRS Notice 2025-42)

tpo_residential_impact.description: Leases and PPAs where commercial entity owns system can still claim 48E
tpo_residential_impact.deadline: System must be placed in service by December 31, 2027
tpo_residential_impact.consumer_benefit: Lower monthly payments due to tax credit passed through to consumer

section_45y_production_credit.name: Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit (Section 45Y)
section_45y_production_credit.notes: Alternative to ITC; developer chooses one or the other. Same begin-construction and placed-in-service deadlines apply.

domestic_content_bonus.name: Domestic Content Bonus Credit
domestic_content_bonus.description: Additional 10 percentage points added to ITC (e.g., 30% becomes 40%) for projects meeting domestic content thresholds
domestic_content_bonus.iron_steel_requirement: 100% U.S. iron and steel for structural components
domestic_content_bonus.notes: Thresholds significantly increased by OBBBA. Must use non-FEOC compliant manufacturers.

energy_community_bonus.name: Energy Community Bonus Credit
energy_community_bonus.description: Additional 10 percentage points for projects in designated energy communities

qualifying_criteria.definition: MSA or non-MSA with >= 0.17% fossil fuel employment AND unemployment rate at or above national average
Census tract containing or adjacent to coal mine closed after 1999 or coal-fired plant retired after 2009

texas_qualifying_areas.description: Multiple Texas counties and census tracts qualify, particularly in West Texas oil/gas regions and areas with retired coal plants
verification_tools: DOE Energy Data eXchange (EDX) mapping tool
notable_qualifying_regions: Areas near retired coal plants (e.g., Monticello, Big Brown, Sandow)

energy_community_bonus.obbba_expansion: Nuclear facilities in MSAs with 0.17%+ nuclear employment also qualify

qualifying_communities.category_1: Poverty rate >= 20% OR median family income <= 80% of statewide median

bonus_depreciation_macrs.name: Modified Accelerated Cost Recovery System (MACRS) + Bonus Depreciation

obbba_changes.100_percent_reinstated: OBBBA reinstates 100% bonus depreciation permanently for property placed in service after January 19, 2025
obbba_changes.macrs_5_year_status: Solar continues to qualify as 5-year MACRS property under Sections 45Y/48E
obbba_changes.energy_property_reclassification: Energy property (solar, wind, standalone storage) with construction beginning after December 31, 2024 removed from 5-year class designation, BUT 100% bonus depreciation effectively supersedes this
obbba_changes.net_effect: Full immediate write-off of capital costs in year of placement in service

bonus_depreciation_macrs.applies_to: Commercial/business solar installations only (not residential homeowner-owned)
bonus_depreciation_macrs.basis_reduction: ITC reduces depreciable basis by 50% of credit amount (e.g., 30% ITC reduces basis by 15%)

credit_transferability.name: Tax Credit Transferability (Section 6418)
credit_transferability.description: Project developers can sell tax credits to unrelated third parties for cash
obbba_restrictions: Transfers to Specified Foreign Entities (SFEs) prohibited
credit_transferability.availability: Continues for duration of underlying credit period

direct_pay_elective_pay.name: Direct Pay / Elective Pay (Section 6417)
direct_pay_elective_pay.mechanism: Credit treated as overpayment of tax, refundable as cash
direct_pay_elective_pay.obbba_impact: Direct pay mechanism preserved, but subject to same credit phase-out deadlines. If underlying credit expires, direct pay has nothing to apply to.
direct_pay_elective_pay.solar_deadline: Begin construction by July 4, 2026; placed in service by December 31, 2027

section_45x_manufacturing_credits.name: Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit (Section 45X)
section_45x_manufacturing_credits.description: Credits for U.S. manufacturing of solar components, reducing domestic equipment costs
section_45x_manufacturing_credits.solar_component_deadline: No credit for integrated solar components (assembled panels) sold after December 31, 2028

integration_requirement.rule: 65% of total direct material costs of secondary components must come from U.S.-mined/produced/manufactured primary components

section_45x_manufacturing_credits.feoc_restriction: Components produced with material assistance from prohibited foreign entities ineligible after July 4, 2025
section_45x_manufacturing_credits.impact_on_equipment_costs: Supports domestic manufacturing buildout, potentially reducing compliant equipment costs

feoc_requirements.name: Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) Requirements
feoc_requirements.specified_foreign_entities: Entities organized under laws of prohibited countries or controlled by them

maximum_combined_itc_example.description: Maximum possible ITC stack for qualifying commercial solar project in 2026
maximum_combined_itc_example.notes: Low-income bonus requires competitive allocation and is capacity-limited

property_tax_exemption.name: Texas Renewable Energy Property Tax Exemption
property_tax_exemption.description: 100% property tax exemption for the added value of solar or wind-powered energy devices installed on residential or commercial property

requirements.primary_use: System must primarily provide power for on-site use
requirements.application_form: Form 50-123 (Exemption Application for Solar or Wind-Powered Energy Devices)
requirements.filing_window: January 1 through April 30 of the year following installation

estimated_value.description: Varies by system size and local tax rates
estimated_value.example_8kw_system: Prevents ~$3,000-$6,000 in added property taxes over system life at typical Texas tax rates of 2-2.5%

sales_tax.name: Texas Sales Tax on Solar Equipment

commercial_manufacturing_exemption.applies_to: Solar modules/panels used in commercial electricity generation for sale

sales_tax.notes: No sales tax exemption for residential solar purchases. Solar equipment for homes is subject to full state + local sales tax.

pace_financing.name: Texas PACE (Property Assessed Clean Energy)
pace_financing.notes: NOT available for single-family residential properties in Texas

solar_rights_act.name: Texas Solar Rights Act
key_provisions: HOAs/POAs cannot prohibit or restrict solar energy device installation
Homeowners must follow normal improvement approval procedures
Written request to Architecture Review Committee required
permitted_hoa_restrictions: Panels extending above roofline or not conforming to roof slope
Elements not in silver, bronze, or black tones

homeowner_petition_right.description: Homeowner can petition for alternate placement if alternate location increases estimated annual production by >10%
homeowner_petition_right.tool: NREL PVWatts Calculator accepted as modeling tool

developer_exception.description: Developers may prohibit solar during development phase for subdivisions of 50 or fewer units

hb_431_solar_roof_tiles.description: Amends Property Code Section 202.010 to explicitly include 'solar roof tiles' in the definition of 'solar energy device', extending HOA protection to integrated solar roof products like Tesla Solar Roof

sb_1036_consumer_protection.name: Residential Solar Retailer Regulatory Act
sb_1036_consumer_protection.administering_agency: Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation (TDLR)
key_provisions: All residential solar retailers and salespersons must register with TDLR by September 1, 2026
Standardized contract language required for clarity
Mandatory cost and financing disclosures at time of solicitation
5 business day right to cancel solar panel sales contracts
Prohibition on implying affiliation with utilities or government agencies
Cannot solicit at residences with 'no soliciting' signs unless invited
Enhanced civil penalties when victims are 65 or older
sb_1036_consumer_protection.impact_on_industry: Increases consumer trust; may reduce door-to-door sales fraud that has plagued Texas solar market

texas_backup_power_package_program.name: Texas Backup Power Package Program
texas_backup_power_package_program.description: Financial incentives to help businesses install reliable backup power sources including solar and storage at critical facilities
texas_backup_power_package_program.funding_source: Texas Energy Fund ($10 billion total authorized)
texas_backup_power_package_program.notes: Part of $5 billion additional TEF funding approved in 89th Legislature for FY2025-2026

hb_3228_decommissioning.name: Solar and Wind Decommissioning and Recycling Requirements
hb_3228_decommissioning.description: Requires recycling of all components capable of being reused or recycled at end of solar or wind facility life
hb_3228_decommissioning.impact: Adds decommissioning cost considerations to large-scale solar project economics

net_metering_state_policy.name: Texas Net Metering Policy
net_metering_state_policy.description: Texas does not mandate net metering at the state level. Each Retail Electricity Provider (REP), municipal utility, or co-op sets its own solar buyback/export policy.
net_metering_state_policy.notes: Approximately 85% of Texas operates in the deregulated ERCOT market where customers choose their REP and buyback terms depend on the chosen plan

solar_rebate.name: Residential Rooftop Solar Rebate
requirements: Installed by Austin Energy Participating Contractor
Complete Austin Energy Solar Education Course before applying

value_of_solar.name: Value of Solar (VoS) Rate
value_of_solar.mechanism: Credits residential solar production at VoS rate for excess energy fed to grid
value_of_solar.notes: Rate may change in March 2026 update

solar_standard_offer.name: Solar Standard Offer Program
solar_standard_offer.description: First-of-its-kind commercial solar incentive program where Austin Energy purchases all solar production at a fixed rate
solar_standard_offer.rate_update_schedule: Every 3 years based on rolling 5-year avoided cost analysis
solar_standard_offer.host_benefit: No utility bill impact to System Host; can lease roof space
solar_standard_offer.expansion_planned: Program expansion to small commercial and residential under development

solar_rebate.name: Residential Solar PV Rebate
solar_rebate.notes: CPS Energy ended residential solar rebates. Program no longer accepting applications.

solarhost.name: SolarHost Program
solarhost.mechanism: CPS installs panels on customer roof at no cost; customer receives bill credit per kWh produced

net_billing.name: Net Billing / Solar Buyback
net_billing.notes: Excess generation above monthly usage credited at avoided-cost rate of $0.02/kWh

oncor_dallas_fort_worth.name: Oncor Residential Solar + Storage Program
oncor_dallas_fort_worth.service_territory: Dallas/Fort Worth metroplex and surrounding areas

solar_battery_rebate.name: Residential Solar PV + Battery Incentive
requirements: Oncor must be electric delivery provider
Battery storage REQUIRED (must be installed simultaneously with solar)

payment_structure.annual_payment: 1/5 of total approved incentive per year

solar_battery_rebate.budget_note: Fixed annual budget (~$12.8M residential, ~$8.5M commercial from $21M+ total); funds often exhausted early in the year. Apply early.
solar_battery_rebate.program_end_notes: Scheduled to close November 30, 2026, or whenever budget is depleted
solar_battery_rebate.payment_method: Incentive paid to Service Provider who passes savings to customer as invoice discount
solar_battery_rebate.battery_location_requirement: All Energy Storage systems must be installed outside the residence (garages, sheds, external walls acceptable)

solar_rebate.name: Standard Offer Solar Rebate
solar_rebate.notes: Program has experienced rapid fund exhaustion. Verify availability directly with CenterPoint before counting on this incentive. First-come, first-served.

programs.name: Smart Thermostat Rebate
programs.value: Up to $75 off ENERGY STAR thermostats

net_metering.name: Net Metering (Rate Schedule 48)
net_metering.credit_description: One-to-one retail rate credit (one of most favorable in Texas)
net_metering.cash_out_description: EPE pays accumulated credits when balance reaches $50
net_metering.meter_installation: Bidirectional meter installed at no cost to customer
net_metering.sizing_requirement: System sized based on previous year electricity consumption

solar_rebate.notes: AEP Texas has historically offered solar rebates. Contact directly for current 2026 availability.

solar_rebate.name: Solar Rebate
solar_rebate.notes: BTU does not offer any local incentives or rebates for solar installation

net_metering.name: Net Metering / Distributed Generation
net_metering.description: Net metering provides credit when solar energy is produced and put back onto the BTU grid
net_metering.interconnection_notes: Application and initial inspection fee payable through City of Bryan CitizenServe Portal

solar_buyback.name: Sustainable Power Credit / DG Interconnection
solar_buyback.rate_basis: Value of Solar Study - market value plus avoided costs

community_solar.name: PEC Community Solar Program
community_solar.description: Members subscribe to a portion of energy from solar sites across PEC territory, up to 100% of average 12-month usage
community_solar.credit_type: Solar Transmission Cost Adjustment (STCA) on bill

solar_rebate.name: Solar PV Rebate
solar_rebate.notes: Solar rebate program discontinued October 2023. Funds redirected to GreenSense energy efficiency program.

greensense.name: GreenSense Energy Efficiency Rebate Program
greensense.description: Rebates for energy efficiency home upgrades including HVAC, insulation, and EV chargers
greensense.notes: Solar PV incentive no longer available through GreenSense as of October 2023

net_billing.name: Solar Export Credit
net_billing.notes: DME proposed reducing export credit from 10.65 cents to 3.79 cents per kWh. Verify current rate directly.

peak_time_payback.name: Peak-Time Payback (PTP) Battery Demand Response
peak_time_payback.description: Battery-based demand response program. Enrolled batteries automatically discharge during peak events to support home and send excess to grid.

vpp_partnership.name: GVEC + Base Power VPP
vpp_partnership.description: Residential batteries provide blackout protection and enable price arbitrage and transmission cost management

smart_battery_program.name: Smart Battery Program
smart_battery_program.requirement: Must live in BEC Fiber zone
smart_battery_program.grid_dispatch: 80% of battery capacity available for grid support during high-demand days; 20% reserved for member

residential_battery_program.name: Residential Battery Program
residential_battery_program.description: First installations of residential battery program for grid support and outage protection

ercot_deregulated_market.description: Most of Texas (excluding Austin, San Antonio, El Paso, co-ops) operates in ERCOT deregulated market
ercot_deregulated_market.how_it_works: Customers choose Retail Electricity Provider (REP). Solar export value depends on chosen plan.

wholesale_price_context.notes: Real-time prices average ~3 cents/kWh but can spike dramatically during peak demand

plans.name: Solar Credit 12
plans.notes: Credits don't expire; good for large arrays with surplus production

octopus_energy.name: Real-Time Wholesale Buyback
octopus_energy.mechanism: Unlimited credits at real-time ERCOT wholesale rate updated every 15 minutes
octopus_energy.best_for: Battery storage owners who can time exports to peak pricing

champion_energy.name: Real-Time Wholesale Solar Plan
champion_energy.mechanism: Based on actual ERCOT market rates

market_trend_2026.description: Most REPs moved away from 1-to-1 net metering
market_trend_2026.real_time_plans: Available but volatile; can earn more during peak summer hours
market_trend_2026.recommendation: Battery storage significantly increases export value by enabling peak-hour dispatch

ercot_ader_pilot.name: ERCOT Aggregate Distributed Energy Resource (ADER) Pilot
ercot_ader_pilot.description: Allows up to 80 MW of capacity from homes and businesses to bid into ERCOT wholesale markets
ercot_ader_pilot.mechanism: Consumer-owned devices virtually aggregated to participate in wholesale electricity market
ercot_ader_pilot.growth_trend: Participation doubled from 3 to 7 ADERs between mid-2025 and late 2025

ercot_drrs.name: Dispatchable Reliability Reserve Service (DRRS)
ercot_drrs.description: New ancillary service compensating resources capable of delivering 4 hours of sustained energy during grid emergencies
ercot_drrs.impact: Encourages buildout of longer-duration storage; creates new revenue stream for solar+storage

ercot_rtcb.name: Real-Time Co-optimization plus Batteries (RTC+B)
ercot_rtcb.description: ERCOT's biggest market change in 15 years; integrates ancillary services into real-time market instead of day-ahead
ercot_rtcb.impact_on_battery_owners: Creates more opportunities for battery storage to earn revenue by providing multiple grid services simultaneously

tesla_powerwall_vpp.name: Tesla Virtual Power Plant
tesla_powerwall_vpp.additional_compensation: Sellback credit for energy exported to grid
tesla_powerwall_vpp.enrollment_process: Via Tesla app; qualification takes up to 2 months after enrollment
restrictions: Cannot be enrolled in another VPP or demand response program
tesla_powerwall_vpp.dispatch_mechanism: Powerwall dispatched with others during grid need; never below user's Backup Reserve setting

sonnen_vpp.name: Sonnen-SOLRITE Virtual Power Plant
sonnen_vpp.model: No upfront cost; solar panels + two sonnenCore+20 batteries installed under 25-year PPA
sonnen_vpp.customer_savings: Up to 40% compared to typical solar PPA
sonnen_vpp.growth_projection: Expected to become largest VPP in Texas by end of 2026, surpassing Tesla
sonnen_vpp.grid_operations: Batteries charge during low wholesale prices (overnight/wind surplus); discharge at daily peaks and during weather-related grid stress

rhythm_energy_vpp.name: Rhythm Energy VPP
rhythm_energy_vpp.description: Residential battery management through VPP, launching in Texas first in 2026

sunrun_nrg_vpp.name: Sunrun + NRG Virtual Power Plant Partnership
sunrun_nrg_vpp.focus: Solar-plus-storage systems aggregated for dispatch during high demand periods

grid_context_2026.description: ERCOT predicts potential supply shortfall during peak summer 2026 demand
grid_context_2026.vpp_opportunity: High demand creates significant earning potential for VPP participants during summer peaks

usda_reap.name: USDA Rural Energy for America Program (REAP)
usda_reap.fy2026_status: Applications expected to open October 1, 2025; delayed. Check USDA Rural Development for updates.
usda_reap.texas_contact: USDA Rural Development Texas State Office
usda_reap.notes: Significant opportunity for rural Texas agricultural operations and small businesses

fha_solar_wind_technologies.name: FHA Solar and Wind Technologies (SWT) Program
fha_solar_wind_technologies.financing_limit: Up to 20% of home's appraised value for solar/wind system
fha_solar_wind_technologies.eligible_properties: 1-4 unit owner-occupied homes or manufactured housing (no condos)
fha_solar_wind_technologies.notes: Allows solar cost to be rolled into FHA mortgage

fha_energy_efficient_mortgage.name: FHA Energy Efficient Mortgage (EEM)
fha_energy_efficient_mortgage.notes: Can finance energy-efficient improvements including solar with FHA-insured mortgage

va_solar_loans.name: VA Energy Efficient Mortgage
va_solar_loans.description: Veterans can use VA loans for solar installations when purchasing or refinancing
va_solar_loans.solar_impact_on_appraisal: VA recognizes added value of solar in home appraisal
va_solar_loans.benefit: Can positively affect loan terms and eligible borrowing amount
va_solar_loans.eligible_borrowers: Veterans, active-duty service members, eligible surviving spouses

hud_programs.name: HUD Community Development Block Grant (CDBG)
hud_programs.description: Communities can use CDBG funds for solar installations as community development
programs: Public and Indian Housing energy improvements

doe_loan_programs.name: DOE Loan Programs Office (LPO)
doe_loan_programs.notes: Primarily for utility-scale and innovative projects, not typical residential

clean_energy_fund_of_texas.name: Clean Energy Fund of Texas (CEFTX)
clean_energy_fund_of_texas.description: First green bank in Texas; nonprofit providing affordable financing for solar, weatherization, and energy efficiency

federal_award.program: EPA Solar for All (Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund)
federal_award.purpose: Deploy residential solar, storage, and upgrades in low-income and disadvantaged communities across the South and Southeast

services: Technical assistance for community solar projects

ercot_deregulated_area.mechanism: Varies by chosen REP and plan
ercot_deregulated_area.real_time_option: Some REPs offer real-time wholesale rate exports
ercot_deregulated_area.recommendation: Compare plans on TexasPowerGuide.com or ChooseEnergy.com

bryan_texas_utilities.mechanism: Credit for solar energy produced and put back onto BTU grid

denton_municipal_electric.notes: Significant rate reduction proposed; verify current rate directly with DME

rural_co_ops.notes: Contact individual co-op for current buyback rates and policies
rural_co_ops.common_structure: Avoided cost or wholesale rate credit

residential_homeowner_owned.scenario: Homeowner purchases and owns solar system in 2026
residential_homeowner_owned.net_savings_impact: Significant reduction in financial incentives compared to 2025. System payback extended 3-5 years.
residential_homeowner_owned.best_strategy: Consider TPO (lease/PPA) instead to benefit from commercial ITC passed through as lower payments

residential_tpo_lease_ppa.scenario: Homeowner uses lease or PPA (third-party ownership) in 2026
residential_tpo_lease_ppa.deadline: System must be placed in service by December 31, 2027
residential_tpo_lease_ppa.consumer_benefit: Lower monthly payments due to ITC passed through by commercial owner
residential_tpo_lease_ppa.depreciation: 100% bonus depreciation claimed by TPO company
residential_tpo_lease_ppa.notes: TPO now more attractive than purchase for residential customers due to ITC availability

commercial_owned.scenario: Business purchases and owns commercial solar system in 2026
commercial_owned.credit_transferability: Can sell credits at ~93-96 cents on dollar

federal.name: SEIA - Clean Energy Provisions in OBBBA
Solar Insure - Final Changes to Solar Tax Credit
IRS - Prevailing Wage and Apprenticeship FAQ
RSM US - OBBBA Clean Energy Credits Changes
IRS - Low-Income Communities Bonus Credit Program
Energy Communities - Tax Credit Bonus FAQ

texas_state.name: Texas Land Conservation - Tax Code Incentives

utility_programs.name: Austin Energy - Value of Solar Rate
Texas Power Guide - Solar Buyback Plans
Quick Electricity - TX Solar Buyback Programs

vpp_programs.name: Texas Tribune - Virtual Power Plants Pilot

federal_programs.name: DOE Energy Data Exchange - Energy Communities
Climate Cabinet - Tax Credit Bonuses Map

texas_legislation.name: Texas Legislature Online - HB 431 Solar Roof Tiles

green_banks_financing.name: EPA Solar for All Grant Awards
